a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:32): Setting the record straight about misleading a generation of coders just because the w3c validator didn't support lint checking...
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:34): Every repost is repost repost, as they say elsewhere
abeb4c0ac6ffb27ee5fbbc20aca0b2f4 (14:52): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: Your use of the word "misleading" is misleading. It's also just plain wrong.
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (15:14): abeb4c0ac6ffb27ee5fbbc20aca0b2f4: I'm sure you believe that, but just saying it won't make it so.
abeb4c0ac6ffb27ee5fbbc20aca0b2f4 (15:30): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: you are either misremembering or misunderstanding (not necessarily deliberately) but either way, what you claim is wrong.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:42): Well, several people have certainly been "misled" in one way or another. Claiming that XHTML is faster, easier to parse, works better on mobiles, etc.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:42): Gives you the ability to use namespaces, ...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:43): It took me quite a while to realize how it really worked.

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:54): (the moral of the story being: never let me think about offhand comments I make)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (15:55): Huh.  The "wrap a div around the figure" trick appears to work.  It makes IE7 forge a proper DOM.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:55): aah, you want to be a markup rockstar b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:55): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I'm good thanks :)

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (15:56): It still styles things slightly funky if you apply the styles to <figure> directly (having made it a normal element through createElement()), but if you style the <div class=figure> instead, it all looks great.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:56): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: <div> is scoping
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (15:56): I'll pretend I understand what that implies.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (15:58): (If someone could explain what that implies, it would be great.)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (15:58): Why should we?  You understand, right?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (15:58): I'm just pretending to.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (15:58): Oh, okay then.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (15:59): We'd better not explain, or it will blow your cover.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (16:01): certain searches in the tree builder stack terminate when encountering a scoping element
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (16:02): Oh, well, that clears everything up, then.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:03): nods sagely, stroking his beard.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (16:03): Do you have a beard?
